item.title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2670) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2024 for military activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 220 - 208 (Roll no. 296). (text: CR H3495)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 220 - 208 (Roll no. 296). (text: CR H3495)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 214 - 207 (Roll no. 295).
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H3501-3503)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 583, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 583.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H3495-3501)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 29.

The resolution provides for further consideration of H. R. 2670 under a structured rule. The resolution makes in order only those further amendments printed in House Report 118-142. One motion to recommit provided.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-142, by Mr. Cole.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-142, by Mr. Cole.

cdata.text: This resolution sets forth the rule for further consideration of H.R. 2670 (National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024, which authorizes appropriations and sets forth policies for Department of Defense programs and activities; military construction; the national security programs of the Department of Energy; the Maritime Administration; the Defense Nuclear Safety Board; and the Naval Petroleum Reserves).

This resolution sets forth the rule for further consideration of H.R. 2670 (National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024, which authorizes appropriations and sets forth policies for Department of Defense programs and activities; military construction; the national security programs of the Department of Energy; the Maritime Administration; the Defense Nuclear Safety Board; and the Naval Petroleum Reserves).

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
